@whatkhdid I mean, I get it to a certain extent. I watched about five minutes and want to go home and clean my house from top to bottom. But ... just once. She seems to want to keep cleaning and then cleaning and then cleaning. And what even IS zoflora?!
lads she's just put a bunch of flowers on a metal tray ON THE HOB. LIKE, IN THE MIDDLE OF HER FOUR-RING ELECTRIC HOB. WHAT THE ACTUAL
@whatkhdid The fabric softener spraying is nuts. All the cushions must be damp? I'll admit I do get a certain satisfaction when things are clean, but this is surely beyond obsessive.
@toodollymakeup I know but that's not the point! It's just so WASTEFUL!
How does Mrs Hinch still have stuff to clean? I just checked the Insta Stories for the first time and I am honestly shocked by how heavy handed she's being with the Cif. My mother would be horrified.

#selfieesteemsaturday because I may not have got out of bed until 3pm but at least I did eventually. Sometimes it's the little steps that feel the biggest ❤️ #mindyourmind https://t.co/ult2LlvmeB https://t.co/7ADaLyPqbi

@notcourtneylove I get you. I hadn't thought about it like that. Like... if your brain is receiving the message that you are experiencing pain, there is no differentiating between that pain being because of a bang you received or because your brain *thinks* you did. It's really fascinating.

@notcourtneylove I feel like there's a different documentary worth making about chronic pain and chronic illness... but honestly this feels like a documentary about people who have severe psychological problems. I don't think "it never is" is true... but I guess people like me are the problem 🙈
